meanings.definition: Annoyingly insensitive or slow to understand
meanings.sent1: She can be so obtuse, always missing the obvious.
meanings.sent2: His obtuse response showed he didn't grasp the situation.
meanings.sent3: It's almost funny how obtuse he can be sometimes.
meanings.sent4: Her obtuse behavior was like trying to explain colors to a blind person.
meanings.sent5: The obtuse way he ignored the signs was truly frustrating.

meanings.definition: Lacking sharpness or quickness of sensibility or intellect
meanings.sent1: The obtuse student struggled to grasp the concept.
meanings.sent2: Her obtuse mind couldn't keep up with the fast-paced discussion.
meanings.sent3: It's amusing how obtuse he becomes when faced with complex ideas.
meanings.sent4: His obtuse reasoning led him down the wrong path.
meanings.sent5: The obtuse way he analyzed the problem was clearly flawed.

meanings.sent1: The obtuse angle of the triangle measured 120 degrees.
meanings.sent2: The obtuse tip of the pencil was rounded from use.
meanings.sent3: It seemed obtuse to use a blunt knife for cutting.
meanings.sent4: The obtuse edge of the table was not sharp at all.
meanings.sent5: The obtuse corner of the room was often overlooked.
